dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Mag 7 Earnings & DeepSeek: What Should Investors Know?
News Content: DeekSeek appears to have put a big dent in what everyone believed was a source of competitive advantage in the AI race for Tech leaders like Microsoft MSFT, Alphabet GOOGL, Amazon AMZN, and others. And if we go by how Microsoft and Meta described the evolving AI competitive landscape on their respective Q4 earnings calls last week, we will most likely hear comparable commentary from Amazon and Alphabet as they come out with their December-quarter results this week.

Market participants have all along been skeptical of the investment case for the extraordinarily heavy spending by Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and others on AI-centric data centers and related infrastructure. The issue all along has been these companies’ inability to articulate a clear case for how these investments will get monetized.

While a lot about DeepSeek’s actual cost in building and training its model is unknown, notwithstanding the announced figure of a few million dollars, the hundreds of billions of dollars that these companies are collectively pouring into the project appears to be overkill. Microsoft and Meta reiterated their spending plans and see the resulting data center capacity as giving them a strategic advantage in the long run. We can safely assume that Amazon and Alphabet will follow Microsoft and Meta on this crucial question.

While the market’s collective focus was mainly on the AI question for Microsoft and Meta, the former disappointed in its core results, with cloud guidance coming up short, while the latter showed plenty of operating momentum in operating results. Microsoft’s December-quarter earnings were up +10.2% from the same period last year on +12.3% higher revenues, while Meta’s earnings and revenues increased +48.7% and +20.6% from the year-earlier levels, respectively.

Apple and Tesla, the other Mag 7 players that also reported results last week, received favorable market reception. However, the positive market follow-through was likely less of a response to the core results and more of a sigh of relief at better-than-feared numbers.

China has emerged as a major risk in the Apple story, with tepid iPhone demand in that key market and the company’s continuing AI struggles taking center stage. Some anecdotal evidence suggests that some of Apple’s local Chinese competitors are giving it a lot tougher competition than in years past. On top of that is the prospect of tariffs, a far bigger issue for Apple than the rest of its Mag 7 peers.

Apple’s December-quarter earnings were up +7.1% on +4% higher revenues, while Tesla’s earnings and revenues for the period were up +15.7% and +2.1% from the year-earlier level, respectively. Net margins were up at Apple and Tesla, with Apple’s margins up 86 basis points from the same period last year while Tesla’s expanded 105 bps.

繼續閱讀

Take a look at the chart below that shows current consensus expectations for the ‘Mag 7’ stocks as a whole for the current and coming periods in the context of what they were able to achieve in the preceding period. The +25.6% earnings growth comprises actual results from the four group members that have reported and estimates for Alphabet, Amazon, and Nvidia (that haven’t reported yet).Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below that shows the group’s earnings and revenue growth on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Beyond these Mag 7 players, total Q4 earnings for the Technology sector as a whole are expected to be up +19.2% from the same period last year on +10.8% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the sector’s Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in recent quarters and what is expected in the coming three periods.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below shows the sector’s growth picture on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The Tech sector has enjoyed a favorable revisions trend for the last few quarters, with the Mag 7 stocks in the fore front of the rising estimates trend. The +16.9% earnings growth expected for the sector for 2025 at present is up from the +15.8% growth expected three months back.

Q4 Earnings Season Scorecard

Through Friday, January 31st, we have seen Q4 results from 179 S&P 500 members, or 35.8% of the index’s total membership. Total earnings for these companies are up +7.4% from the same period last year on +5.1% higher revenues, with 80.4% beating EPS estimates and 67% beating revenue estimates.

The comparison charts below put the Q4 earnings and revenue growth rates relative to other recent periods for the same group of index members.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The comparison charts below put the Q4 EPS and revenue beats percentages relative to other recent periods for the same group of companies.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Key Earnings Reports This Week

The 132 S&P 500 members on deck to report results this week include several blue-chip operators like Pfizer, Pepsi, Ford, and others, in addition to the aforementioned Mag 7 players (Amazon and Alphabet).

By the end of this week, we will have seen Q4 results from more than 63% of the index’s total membership.

The Earnings Big Picture

The chart below shows the Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in the preceding four quarters and what is expected in the coming four quarters.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Excluding the contribution from the Mag 7 companies, S&P 500 earnings would have been up +5.6% on +4.1% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the overall earnings picture on a calendar-year basis, with double-digit earnings growth expected in 2025 and 2026.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Please note that the very strong growth expected in 2025 is not driven by one or two sectors but is rather broad-based. All 16 Zacks sectors are expected to enjoy positive earnings growth in 2025, with 8 of the 16 Zacks sectors expected to achieve double-digit earnings growth.

For a detailed look at the overall earnings picture, including expectations for the coming periods, please check out our weekly Earnings Trends report >>>> Broad Based Sector Growth Expected for 2025

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple Inc. is struggling to innovate in AI, which is a critical area for growth in the tech sector. The downgrade from Oppenheimer, citing a weaker outlook for iPhone sales and challenges in the Chinese market, adds to the negative sentiment. The lack of generative AI applications and a slower iPhone replacement cycle further suggest that Apple may face difficulties in maintaining its premium valuation. Given these factors, the probability of the stock price falling is higher than that of it rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed bag for Apple (AAPL). On one hand, the emergence of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, raises concerns about increased competition and potential cost efficiencies in AI development, which could indirectly benefit Apple. Tim Cook's comment suggests a positive view on innovation that drives efficiency. However, the article also mentions Apple's revenue being down 11% year-over-year in China, which is a significant negative factor. The overall impact is likely to be slightly negative, as the China revenue decline is a more immediate and direct concern than the potential long-term benefits of DeepSeek's innovations. The market's initial reaction (avoiding the DeepSeek sell-off) suggests some resilience, but the China issue is a persistent headwind.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Apple's Q4 earnings beat expectations and showed positive net margin expansion, concerns remain regarding tepid iPhone demand in China, increased competition from local Chinese rivals, and the potential impact of tariffs.  The article highlights the overall positive sentiment towards the tech sector and the Mag 7 group, with strong earnings growth projections for 2025. However, the focus on AI investments by competitors and their uncertain monetization strategies could indirectly impact Apple's valuation relative to its peers.  The positive market reaction to Apple's earnings was described as a 'sigh of relief' rather than enthusiastic approval, suggesting a cautious market sentiment. Considering these factors, the probability of a price rise is lower than a neutral probability, but the overall market sentiment and strong sector projections offer some support.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights DeepSeek's competitive AI models, which have caused a sell-off in global tech stocks, raising concerns about Big Tech's AI spending. However, the CEOs of Microsoft, Meta, and Apple have responded optimistically, suggesting that innovation and efficiency driven by DeepSeek could benefit the industry. Apple's stock avoided the initial sell-off, and Tim Cook's comments reflect a positive outlook on innovation. However, Apple's declining revenue in China could be a counterbalancing factor. Overall, the market reaction seems mixed but leans slightly positive due to the optimistic tone from Big Tech leaders.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's stock price rose in premarket trading following a strong sales growth forecast. This suggests that investors are reassured by Apple's guidance, which forecasts revenue growth in the low- to mid-single digits for the coming quarter. Given this positive reaction and the overall market sentiment, it is likely that Apple's stock price will continue to rise. However, the market is also awaiting key inflation data, which could influence the Federal Reserve's policy decisions and impact stock prices broadly.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.8, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's fiscal Q1 results beat estimates, which is a positive indicator for the company's financial health and performance. This typically leads to an increase in investor confidence and, consequently, a rise in stock price. Given this information, it is reasonable to estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: Apple Inc. (AAPL) reported better-than-expected earnings for its fiscal 2025 first quarter, with a notable highlight being the strong performance in its services revenue. Despite potential mixed performance in other segments, the overall beat on analyst estimates is likely to have a positive impact on investor sentiment, which typically translates into a stock price rise.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple Inc. is struggling to innovate in AI, which is a critical area for growth in the tech sector. The downgrade from Oppenheimer highlights a weaker outlook for iPhone sales and challenges in the Chinese market, contributing to negative sentiment. The lack of generative AI applications and a slower iPhone replacement cycle further suggest difficulties in maintaining its premium valuation. While there are some mixed signals regarding competition and potential long-term benefits, the overall sentiment leans negative due to the immediate concerns raised in the news. Therefore, the probability of the stock price falling is higher than that of it rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the emergence of DeepSeek and its potential to drive efficiency in AI development could be seen as a positive for the industry, including Apple, the article also highlights Apple's declining revenue in China, which is a significant concern. Tim Cook's comments suggest a cautiously optimistic view on innovation. The previous predictions are quite varied, with some leaning towards a price decrease due to concerns about innovation and China revenue, while others are more optimistic. Considering the mixed signals and the previous predictions, I will slightly lean towards a neutral to slightly negative outlook.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Q4 earnings beat expectations and showed positive net margin expansion, significant headwinds exist. Tepid iPhone demand in China, intensified competition from local rivals, and potential tariff impacts are major concerns.  The positive market reaction to Apple's earnings was characterized as a 'sigh of relief,' suggesting cautious optimism rather than strong confidence.  The emergence of DeepSeek and its impact on AI spending by competitors introduces uncertainty, although Apple's own AI struggles are also highlighted.  While the broader tech sector shows positive growth projections, Apple's specific challenges in China and AI weigh heavily. Considering the mixed signals and the previous predictions showing a range from 0.25 to 0.8 probability of a price rise, a moderate probability of a price rise is assigned, acknowledging the significant downside risks.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On the positive side, DeepSeek's competitive AI models have sparked a broader discussion about innovation and efficiency in the tech sector, with Apple's CEO Tim Cook expressing optimism about such advancements. Apple's stock also avoided the initial sell-off triggered by DeepSeek's announcement, indicating some resilience. However, Apple's significant revenue decline in China (down 11% year-over-year) is a notable negative factor. The market's reaction to the news appears mixed, with some models leaning slightly positive due to the optimistic tone from Big Tech leaders, while others highlight the immediate concerns in China. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is slightly higher than falling, but the overall sentiment remains cautious.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's stock price rose in premarket trading following a strong sales growth forecast. This suggests that investors are reassured by Apple's guidance, which forecasts revenue growth in the low- to mid-single digits for the coming quarter. The positive premarket trading of Apple Inc. (AAPL) by 3.4% and the overall positive sentiment in the tech sector, despite concerns about inflation data and global market trends, contribute to a favorable outlook for Apple's stock price. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than that of it falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's fiscal Q1 results beat estimates, which is a positive indicator for the company's financial health and performance. This typically leads to an increase in investor confidence and, consequently, a rise in stock price. Considering the previous predictions from various models, there is a trend towards a positive outlook, with some models indicating a higher probability of the stock price rising. The overall market sentiment, as indicated by the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 being up, also supports a positive outlook.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news indicates that Apple's Q1 earnings beat analysts' estimates, particularly due to a jump in services revenue. This positive earnings report is likely to boost investor confidence and result in a stock price rise. Although there were concerns about mixed performance in certain segments and challenges in the Chinese market, the overall positive sentiment from various predictions and the market's typical reaction to beating estimates suggest a higher likelihood of a stock price increase.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple Inc. is struggling to innovate in AI, which is a critical area for growth in the tech sector. The downgrade from Oppenheimer highlights a weaker outlook for iPhone sales and challenges in the Chinese market, contributing to negative sentiment. The lack of generative AI applications and a slower iPhone replacement cycle further suggest difficulties in maintaining its premium valuation. While there are some mixed signals regarding competition and potential long-term benefits, the overall sentiment leans negative due to the immediate concerns raised in the news. Therefore, the probability of the stock price falling is higher than that of it rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. DeepSeek's emergence and the optimistic responses from Big Tech CEOs like Tim Cook suggest potential benefits from increased efficiency and innovation in AI. However, Apple's declining revenue in China remains a significant concern. The previous predictions show a wide range, reflecting the uncertainty. Some models lean towards a price decrease due to concerns about innovation and China revenue, while others are more optimistic. Considering the mixed signals and the trend of previous predictions, I'm slightly adjusting towards a more neutral outlook, acknowledging both the potential benefits and the existing challenges. The fact that Apple avoided the initial DeepSeek sell-off is a positive sign, but the China issue is persistent.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed picture for Apple. While Q4 earnings beat expectations and net margins expanded, significant concerns remain.  Tepid iPhone demand in China, increased competition, and potential tariffs pose substantial headwinds. The positive market reaction was described as a 'sigh of relief,' indicating cautious optimism rather than strong confidence.  The emergence of DeepSeek adds uncertainty regarding AI spending and competitive dynamics.  While the broader tech sector shows positive growth projections, Apple's specific challenges outweigh the general positive sentiment.  Analyzing the previous predictions, there's a wide range of probabilities for a price rise (0.25 to 0.8), reflecting the uncertainty. Considering the mixed signals and the significant downside risks, a slightly pessimistic outlook is warranted, but not overwhelmingly so. The overall market sentiment and strong sector projections offer some support, preventing an extremely negative prediction.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On the positive side, the emergence of DeepSeek and its competitive AI models has sparked discussions about innovation and efficiency in the tech sector, with Apple's CEO Tim Cook expressing optimism about such advancements. Apple's stock also avoided the initial sell-off triggered by DeepSeek's announcement, indicating some resilience. However, Apple's significant revenue decline in China (down 11% year-over-year) is a notable negative factor. The market's reaction to the news appears mixed, with some models leaning slightly positive due to the optimistic tone from Big Tech leaders, while others highlight the immediate concerns in China. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is slightly higher than falling, but the overall sentiment remains cautious.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple's stock price rose in premarket trading following a strong sales growth forecast. This suggests that investors are reassured by Apple's guidance, which forecasts revenue growth in the low- to mid-single digits for the coming quarter. The positive premarket trading of Apple Inc. (AAPL) by 3.4% and the overall positive sentiment in the tech sector, despite concerns about inflation data and global market trends, contribute to a favorable outlook for Apple's stock price. However, the market is also awaiting key inflation data, which could influence the Federal Reserve's policy decisions and impact stock prices broadly. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising seems higher than that of it falling, but with a cautious outlook due to the mixed signals and potential headwinds in the Chinese market.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.72, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.28, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's fiscal Q1 results beat estimates, which is a positive indicator for the company's financial health and performance. This typically leads to an increase in investor confidence and, consequently, a rise in stock price. Considering the previous predictions from various models, there is a trend towards a positive outlook, with some models indicating a higher probability of the stock price rising. The overall market sentiment, as indicated by the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 being up, also supports a positive outlook. However, some models also highlight concerns about mixed performance in certain segments and challenges in the Chinese market, which could negatively impact the stock price. Taking into account the positive earnings report, the trend of previous predictions, and the overall market sentiment, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news indicates that Apple's Q1 earnings beat analysts' estimates, particularly due to a jump in services revenue. This positive earnings report is likely to boost investor confidence and result in a stock price rise. Previous predictions show a trend towards positivity, with multiple models predicting a higher probability of the stock price rising. Despite some concerns about mixed performance in certain segments and challenges in the Chinese market, the overall positive sentiment from the latest earnings report and historical predictions strongly suggest a higher probability of the stock price rising.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows:

} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

The emergence of DeepSeek and its impact on AI spending by competitors introduces further uncertainty, although Apple's own AI struggles are also highlighted. The overall tech sector shows positive growth projections, but Apple's specific challenges in China and AI weigh heavily.  Analyzing the previous predictions reveals a wide range of probabilities for a price rise (0.25 to 0.8), reflecting the considerable uncertainty.  Considering the mixed signals and the significant downside risks, a slightly pessimistic outlook is warranted, but not overwhelmingly so. The overall market sentiment and strong sector projections offer some support, preventing an extremely negative prediction. The consistent negative sentiment regarding China sales and AI competitiveness across multiple prediction rounds weighs heavily on the overall assessment.",
